Articles.Content: Anyone know of any good OMS-Style Monopropellant engines. I know Ven's SPR has one, but that one seems massively unbalanced right now and couldn't push a Mk3 shuttle without a huge many of them. Are there any other options out there?
Modular Rocket Systems has a .625m Monoprop engine

Modular Rocket Systems has a .625m Monoprop engine

I'll take a look, I'm already using his Fuel Tank mod anyway.

- - - Updated - - -

Not really what I'm looking for. His engine size makes more sense compared to it's thrust, but I need bigger and more thrust. Vens "should" be the right size for a Mk3 Shuttle OMS and even looks like a Shuttle OMS, but for some reason it has the equivalent thrust of 2 O-10's. Unfortunately not enough to adequately push a full sized shuttle. I could just change the config and may resort to that eventually, but I'd rather have something not modded by me if I can. It makes it easier to share the craft listing dependencies.
RLA is a good mod for all things monoprop

Space-y (?) has some beefy OMS pods, but I don't recall if they're monoprop; I seem to remember using them as such though. Same creator as MRS, so there is some(!) compatibility without much overlap in parts.

Was something like this what you had in mind?

They're 1.25m, 120 thrust, gimballed, integrated RCS, and the shoulders they're mounted on hold Monopropellant.

Edited September 30, 2015 by SuicidalInsanity
